eu.trentorise.opendata.traceprov.dcat

Class AbstractDcatCatalogRecord

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.trentorise.opendata.traceprov.dcat.AbstractDcatCatalogRecord

  • @Value.Immutable
public abstract class AbstractDcatCatalogRecord
extends Object
    A record in a data catalog, describing a single dataset, as specified by dcat:CatalogRecorda This class is optional and not all catalogs will use it. It exists for catalogs where a distinction is made between metadata about a dataset and metadata about the dataset's entry in the catalog. For example, the publication date property of the dataset reflects the date when the information was originally made available by the publishing agency, while the publication date of the catalog record is the date when the dataset was added to the catalog. As a practical example, while :dataset-001 was issued on 2011-12-05, its description on Imaginary Catalog was added on 2011-12-11. This can be represented by DCAT as in the following: 
     :catalog dcat:record :record-001 .
 :record-001 a dcat:CatalogRecord ;
             foaf:primaryTopic :dataset-001 ;
             dct:issued "2011-12-11"^^xsd:date; .
    In cases where both dates differ, or where only the latter is known, the publication date should only be specified for the catalog record. Notice that the W3C PROV Ontology [prov-o] allows describing further provenance information such as the details of the process and the agent involved in a particular change to a dataset.
    Author:
    David Leoni

    • Method Detail

      • getDescription

        @Value.Default
public Dict getDescription()
        free-text account of the record, as specified by dct:description

      • getIssued

        public abstract com.google.common.base.Optional<org.joda.time.DateTime> getIssued()
        The date of listing the corresponding dataset in the catalog, as specified by dct:issued. This indicates the date of listing the dataset in the catalog and not the publication date of the dataset itself. Note DCAT standard requires dates in string format to be ISO 8601 Date and Time compliant string format i.e. "2011-12-11".
        See Also:
        AbstractDcatDataset.getIssued()

      • getModified

        public abstract com.google.common.base.Optional<org.joda.time.DateTime> getModified()
        Most recent date on which the catalog entry was changed, updated or modified. This indicates the date of last change of a catalog entry, i.e. the catalog metadata description of the dataset, and not the date of the dataset itself. Specified by dct:modified
        See Also:
        AbstractDcatDataset.getModified()

      • getPrimaryTopic

        public abstract com.google.common.base.Optional<AbstractDcatDataset> getPrimaryTopic()
        Links the catalog record to the dcat:Dataset resource described in the record. Each catalog record can have at most one primary topic i.e. describes one dataset. Specified by foaf:primaryTopic

      • getTitle

        @Value.Default
public Dict getTitle()
        A name given to the record, as specified by dct:title

      • getUri

        @Value.Default
public String getUri()
        Property not in DCAT spec. This should uniquely identify the record.
